messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Phantom Pharaoh Fiasco DATE: 06/06/50 The courtroom resonated with the echoing deliberations as the trial proceeded. The prosecution called upon the officers involved in the investigation to testify. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and your role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Lieutenant A. B. Allen, the chief investigator of this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Lieutenant Allen. Can you recount the events that led to the discovery of the Phantom Pharaoh's tomb raiding? WITNESS: Certainly. On the night of February 29th, Officer C. D. Baker noticed unusual activity at the historical site and reported it. We initiated an investigation shortly thereafter. PROSECUTOR: Who was responsible for the forensic analysis? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Carter and Technician G. H. Davis were assigned to the forensic examination. PROSECUTOR: And the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Evans and K. L. Foster handled the interviews with the suspects and the museum staff. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense cross-examined Lieutenant Allen regarding the measures taken to secure the historical site and the investigative procedures. During the trial, Patrol Officers M. N. Gray, O. P. Hayes, and Q. R. Ingram were also called to testify.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lieutenant A. B. Allen 
Officer Context: Lieutenant Allen is the chief investigator of the Phantom Pharaoh Fiasco case and provided testimony regarding the discovery of the tomb raiding incident. 
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Baker 
Officer Context: Officer Baker reported unusual activity at the historical site on the night of February 29th, which led to the initiation of the investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Carter 
Officer Context: Sergeant Carter, along with Technician G. H. Davis, was responsible for the forensic examination of the scene. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Davis 
Officer Context: Technician Davis worked alongside Sergeant E. F. Carter on the forensic examination of the case. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Evans 
Officer Context: Detective Evans, along with Detective K. L. Foster, conducted interviews with suspects and museum staff to gather more information regarding the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. Foster 
Officer Context: Detective Foster collaborated with Detective I. J. Evans to carry out the interrogations, aiming to shed light on the tomb raiding incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officers M. N. Gray, O. P. Hayes, and Q. R. Ingram 
Officer Context: These Patrol Officers were called to testify during the trial, although their specific roles in the investigation were not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officers
